Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 29 Jan 2024 | Created 19 Oct 2011

This page has been accessed 403 times.

Biography

LEVI STEARNS,[1] b. at Littleton, 12 January 1765,[2] son of Thomas Stearns and Mary Barrett.

Levi married at Lunenburg, 7 January 1794,[3] ELIZABETH GOODRIDGE, who was born at Lunenburg, 14 July 1768,[4] daughter of Philip and Jane (Boynton) Goodridge. Elizabeth died at Lunenburg, 11 October 1810.[5]

Levi died at Lunenburg, 25 December 1810.[6]

Levi Stearns was born in Littleton and settled in Lunenburg. He was ensign in the Lunenburg militia, served as collector in 1796, and was on the school committee in 1806.[7] In 1810, Levi Stearns headed a household of ten persons in Lunenburg: one male 45 and over, one female 26 to 44, two males under 10; two males 10 to 15, one male 16 to 25, two females under 10, and one female 10 to 15.[8] Elizabeth and Levi died ten weeks apart in 1810, leaving eight children the oldest of whom was sixteen.

The estate of Levi Stearns was in probate by 7 January 1811 when Esek Whiting and Jonathan Bailey were named to take the inventory. On 29 August 1811 Noah Stearns of Littleton was named as administrator with Simon Goodridge and Jonah Stearns of Lunenburg as sureties for the bond. The whole of the estate was sold with proceeds of $891.80 from the sale of the personal estate and $2,073.81 from the real estate.[9] Thomas Stearns was named as guardian to Thomas Stearns and Abel Stearns.[10] Simon Goodridge was named as guardian to William Stearns and Betsy Stearns.[11] Noah Stearns was named as guardian for Levi Stearns, Theresa Stearns, Nancy Stearns, and Charles Stearns.[12]

Levi’s brother Noah Stearns did not marry. In his will written 17 September 1829, Noah left the bulk of his estate to his nephew Charles Stearns whom Noah raised after the death of Levi. Noah had small bequests to some of his many nieces and nephews; among these were William Stearns, Thomas Stearns, Betsey Joslin, Theresa Stearns, and Nancy Stearns.[13]

Children

Elizabeth Goodridge and Levi Stearns were parents of ten children recorded in the Lunenburg town records.[14]

i THOMAS STEARNS, b. 1 Apr 1794; d. at Leominster, 15 Dec 1861; m. 1st at Leominster, 12 Jun 1817, THIRZA BURRAGE, b. at Leominster, 16 Jun 1799 daughter of William and Mary (Joslin) Burrage; Thirza d. at Leominster, 10 May 1819. Thomas m. 2nd at Leominster, 30 Sep 1820, POLLY BRIGHAM, b. at Leominster, 29 Dec 1792 daughter of Joel and Elizabeth (Maynard) Brigham; Polly d. at Leominster, 7 Dec 1863.

ii LEVI STEARNS, b. 19 Mar 1795; d. 11 Nov 1800.

iii ABEL STEARNS, b. 9 Apr 1798; d. at San Francisco, CA, 23 Aug 1871; m. 22 Jun 1841, MARÍA ARCADIA FRANCISCA DE PAULA BANDINI Y ESTUDILLO, baptized at San Diego, 14 Jan 1827 daughter of Juan and Dolores (Estudillo) Bandini; Maria d. at Santa Monica, 15 Sep 1912, Maria m. 2nd Robert Symington Baker.

iv WILLIAM STEARNS (twin), b. 17 Nov 1799; d. at Boston, 19 Nov 1875; m. at Leominster, 10 Sep 1831, DORINDA JOSLIN, b. at Leominster, 3 Jan 1807 daughter of Elias and Prudence (Lincoln) Joslin; Dorinda d. at Boston, 17 Oct 1850.

v ELIZABETH STEARNS (twin), b.17 Nov 1799; d. at Leominster, 24 Jan 1885; m. at Leominster, 11 Apr 1819, ELIAS JOSLIN, b. at Leominster, 10 Nov 1795 son of Elias and Prudence (Lincoln) Joslin; Elias d. at Leominster, 11 Jul 1874.

vi LEVI STEARNS, b. 24 Dec 1802; d. at Townsend, 21 Sep 1885; m. at Townsend, 5 Oct 1826, DEREXA JEWETT, b. at Townsend, 10 Nov 1806 daughter of Solomon and Phebe (Adams) Jewett; Derexa d. at Townsend, 12 Jan 1884.

vii ABIGAIL STEARNS, b. 21 Mar 1804; d. 11 Apr 1808.

viii THERESA STEARNS, b. 11 Jan 1806; d. at Boston, 7 Feb 1881; m. at Littleton, 18 Apr 1832, JAMES WARREN, b. at Littleton, 16 Sep 1798 son of James and Susanna (Wheeler) Warren; James d. at Littleton, 13 Feb 1838.

ix NANCY STEARNS, b. 30 Jun 1807; d. at Lowell, 14 Jun 1888; m. Dec 1833, PETER MANNING, b. at Townsend, 11 Dec 1791 son of Peter and Rebecca (Carter) Manning; Peter d. at Lowell, 4 Aug 1855. Peter was first married to Nancy’s first cousin Elizabeth Kimball (1796-1833).

x CHARLES STEARNS, b. 16 Jun 1809; d. at Townsend, 4 Apr 1898. Charles did not marry. He was a merchant in Littleton.
